oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance and discussion - James "Goober" Buchanan - 2005-05-21
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by and discussion about the career of James "Goober" Buchanan from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on May 21, 2005
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: James Buchanan; Henry Strzelecki; Billy Robinson; Jack Bowles;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Program begins in progress. Includes questions from the audience. Introduction of host John Rumble. Introduction of James "Goober" Buchanan. Subjects include; Recreation of Goober's radio show -- Radio theme -- Long Tall Texan (Henry Strzelecki-vocal) -- Introduction of Grandpappy -- The Farmer's Daughter (Grandpappy) -- Steel Guitar Rag (Billy Robinson-steel) -- I'll Fly Away (Randy Lane-vocal) -- Comedy skit (Grandpappy) -- Closing theme with voice over -- Signal break then low level audio -- Discussion begins with Jack Bowles talking about the influence of Buchanan on him as a child -- Buchanan talks about his days at WSIX radio in Nashville and working as a performer in the 1940's and being sponsored by Reuben furniture -- Billy Robinson talks about meeting Buchanan -- Mentions helping Big Jeff Bess get his first work -- Working tent shows and why tent shows were successful -- Buchanan tells story about playing in Alaska --
Scrapbook donation to the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum collection -- closing comments - recording continues after the end of the program.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Buchanan, James; Strzelecki, Henry; Robinson, Billly; Bowles, Jack; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
